subtitleNullable: The catastrophic flood of the Ahr 14-07-2021 in Germany.
descriptionNullable:
### Context
Flood disasters  in the Ahr valley have occured since 1348, based on written records. 
The flood of 14-07-2021 was a monster. But there are numerous accounts of historians and geographers in the last 150 years, which were warning for the danger of a repetition of a mass flood event. Still, the official data records used data for flood estimation only starting from the 1970's, except for Altenahr, which started in 1947.
This is the story of relying on unrealistic data, versus the alarms of scientists who understood what mayhem could be unleashed by studying the older and newer records and data.

### Content
Water level data starting from 1946 or the 1970's, and 14-07-2021, from the official flood alert hochwassermeldung, rainfall and water level websites. Also private pluviometer data added. See the notebook for a table with more info about the waterlevel stations, and their location plus lat. and longitude. 

### Acknowledgements
We would like to thank the researchers who warned that this catastrophic flood could happen again in the right circumstances. 
The updated 2nd publication after 25 years about an equally disastrous flood ... https://kreis-ahrweiler.de/kvar/VT/hjb1955/hjb1955.11.htm
A publication documenting that these big floods occured many times in history  https://www.kreis-ahrweiler.de/kvar/VT/hjb1983/hjb1983.25.htm

### Inspiration
Can you find the repeat interval for the 2021 flood? At what time was the peak water level in Altenahr, and how high?
#### Tip
The phenomenon of hysteresis applies here: the maximum outflow arrives before the maximum water level.
